e
States

5 March 1589

page.lettertext:
fol.224r
Copie./
Sir, to the same effect, as the Councell of estate hath written unto yo
u
,
w
ch
I have also certified by former l
res
, it is her
Ma
ties
pleasure, that
her highnes auxiliary forces in theis countries shalbe only disposed
by the Councell of estate, whereof I doe not doubt but yo
u
have
held from home sufficient advertisement, For w
ch
cause, as also
for that there are at this time manie opportunities offred to
doe speciall good
s
vice, against the Enimie, I thought it
verie requisit, and belonginge to my Charge, to accompanie
their l
res
w
th
theis fewe lines, and to move yo
u
to consider
howe muche it doth importe the state / to have the content
of their l
res
fulfilled, w
ch
also this bearer martaint can
declare more at large, to whome I referre yo
u
and co
m
end
yo
r
welfare to gods preservac
o
n./
From the
hage
m
r
che
15
th
1589
.
Yo
r
most assured
Tho Bodley
